title: Thunderbird thinks every message since Mar20 is junk.
content:
This is meant as Feedback, not a Bug report (unless others get the same thing). I suspect it can't be reproduced consistently.

Every message (since Mar20) shows a yellow error bar: "Thunderbird thinks this message is Junk mail." [Learn More] [Not Junk] [X] Just as I'm composing this, messages also have inconsistent coloring (picture attached).

Since the message says "Thunderbird...", I'm posting here and not google/gmail. NOTE I just tried the Learn More link and may be able to reset the "learning" so this post may have been unnecessary. Still - an unpleasant experience. I did locate the [Reset training data] in Settings and may have to use that.

BACKGROUND: I migrated from another Mac in January, that seems to be unrelated. I downloaded several apps from the App Store the day before (Mar 19) but those all seem unrelated. Some Mar20 messages are fine.

I'm running Thunderbird 115.9.0 (64-bit) "supernova" and "Thunderbird is up to date" on macOS Ventura 13.6.3

Hopefully this is the end of this story for me! Thanks. Please let me know if other details might be helpful for this discussion.
creator: ahengst.edm

title: How to tell if Thunderbird or ISP sends good emails to junk?
content:
Is there a way to tell whether it's Thunderbird or my ISP that is sending good emails to junk?

I recently moved to TB (115.7.0 on OpenSuSE Linux) from an older Opera email. Since then, I have had a problem with good emails - from my credit union, companies I do business with, even mailing lists I subscribe to - showing up in Junk Mail. I have tried following TB's whitelisting directions on the web, and have also tried whitelisting through my ISP (Charter/Spectrum), but nothing I've done so far seems to have much effect.

Before I head further down the rabbit hole, I would like to know if there's any way of determining whether it's TB or the ISP that's flagging stuff as junk, so I can concentrate on the source of the problem.

And of course any suggestions as to how to actually fix the problem would be more than welcome!
creator: jamesqf

title: Network calendar events are off by 1 hour
content: Thunderbird's Calendar displays time for events from Google's calendar (probably other network calendars too) incorrectly. For example, i create an event with "New Event", select "Calendar: <my gmail account>" and set "Start: 15:00", "End: 16:00", then "Save and Close". Thunderbird Calendar displays it as from 16:00 to 17:00. "Use system timezone" is selected in Calendar settings. When i open "Edit" dialog for the event, time in "Start:" and "End:" fields is also incorrect (16:00 and 17:00 respectively). However, when i go to "Options" and click "Show Timezones" it becomes correct (15:00 and 16:00). Disabling "Show Timezones" leads back to incorrect time. Web page and other applications display time for the same event correctly (as i set it during creation). The same error for events created not by Thunderbird but on web page or other applications. Thunderbird 115.9.0.
creator: dimich.dmb

title: Thunderbird email account
content:
For now, my question pertains to a Thunderbird account password. This becomes a question because I have been trying to transfer Thunderbird to a new laptop and am asked for a password for mobile.charter.net--which is unfamiliar to me. To get questions answered about that mystery password, I need a Thunderbird account password, both unknown to me and not found by Mozilla support. Support gave me clear steps to get here, so here I am. 

I have used Thunderbird for email since 2019--seemingly without the need of a password for a Thunderbird account.  Now to the question:  Has something changed since 2019 with regard to setting up an email account  to explain the lack of a password?

A second question: Why am I asked for a password for mobile.charter.net (in trying to set up Thunderbird on a new laptop) when my Internet service is with Spectrum (formerly Time Warner)?

Thanks for your help. Janet

title: Thunderbird vypíná službu zařazování tisku
content: Dobrý den, aktuálně mám TH 115.9.0 (64 bitů) na Win11Pro. Jakmile spustím TH, dojde do cca 30vteřin k ukončení služby zařazování tisku (Spooler SubSystem App - svchost.exe), což způsobí, že žádná aplikace není schopna najít žádnou tiskárnu a není schopna tisknout. Samotný TH je pouze schopen uložit email jako PDF, ale ostatní tiskárny také není schopen najít. Po vypnutí TH dochází okamžitě k automatickému restartu svchost.exe a služba zařazování tisku se obnovuje a ze všech aplikací je pak již možno tisknout standardně. Tento problém eviduji již delší dobu i v dřívějších buildech TH, ale až nyní jsem měl čas vysledovat, co přesně se děje. Prosím o radu, jak eliminovat tento konflikt TH a služby zařazování tisku. Děkuji. Jakub Wyderka

title: Two "Upgrade" complaints
content:
I used to like Thunderbird, a lot. I've used it for more than 13 years. I have also contributed money - because I believe in paying for a good product. I think Thunderbird is quickly moving away from being a 'good product'.

I have two big complaints now with Thunderbird.

1. Apparently the 'developers' just can't stop themselves from adding more and more "stuff" (called "features"). All I want is a decent email client. The tabs to open PDF attachments was a nice feature, when it was added. However, the vast majority of so-called "features" that have been added over the past few years are useless to me. And it shows in how big the Thunderbird application has become and how long it now takes to load and display.

2. The 'threaded' crap is driving me nuts. It seems like every time Thunderbird updates it puts some/most/all of the folders back to 'sort by threaded' and displaying the thread column and star column. I hate 'threaded'. If you are updating the application why can't you import my 'custom' settings or at least just leave them alone. No, you reset all kinds of stuff with nearly every "update".

I guess I have two options: 1. I will quit updating Thunderbird (disable auto-update, if that's possible). 2. Find a new email client that is simpler, smaller, loads quicker, and is less cluttered with "features".

Thank you for taking a decent product and 'improving' the hell out of it - to the point where I am starting to hate it.
creator: hoeldd533
